intro: Leptoderris mildbraedii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces elongated pods that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rapid growth and showy display make it a notable feature in botanical gardens and landscapes.
